sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Insure the path to all daemons are in /usr/sbin, rather than the default path of /usr/etc:
The format of the /etc/xinetd.conf is documented in the xinetd.conf man page. Further information can be found at .
Install /etc/rc.d/init.d/xinetd init script included in the package.
Now, we'll use our new boot script to start xinetd:
Checking the /var/log/daemon.log file should prove quite entertaining. This file may contain entries similar to the following:

screen.userinput: Aug 22 21:40:21 dps10 xinetd[2696]: Server /usr/sbin/in.rlogind is not executable [line=29] Aug 22 21:40:21 dps10 xinetd[2696]: Error parsing attribute server - DISABLING SERVICE [line=29] Aug 22 21:40:21 dps10 xinetd[2696]: Server /usr/sbin/in.rshd is not executable [line=42]

sect3.para: These errors are due to the fact that we don't have most of the servers that xinetd is trying to control installed yet.
